definition: zero/nought/zero sign/fractional/fragmentary/odd (of numbers)/(placed between two numbers to indicate a smaller quantity followed by a larger one)/fraction/(in mathematics) remainder (after division)/extra/to wither and fall/to wither
to use/to employ/to have to/to eat or drink/expense or outlay/usefulness/hence/therefore
gold/chemical element Au/generic term for lustrous and ductile metals/money/golden/highly respected/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]

sentences.english: I will be in charge of the petty cash from now on.
sentences.chinese: 從今天開始零用金將由我負責。

sentences.english: How much petty cash do we have left after paying for the trip to the conference?
sentences.chinese: 在支付完去研討會的旅費後，我們還剩下多少零用金？

sentences.english: Our company's petty cash always seems to be empty.
sentences.chinese: 我們公司的零用金好像總是空的。

definition: expenses for 治裝|治装[zhi4 zhuang1]
to pay in advance/to get payment in advance
variant of 巨額|巨额[ju4 e2]
expenditures/expenses/CL:筆|笔[bi3], 項|项[xiang4]/to spend money/(coll.) to pay wages
